description:
My boyfriend + I were in the area for the Autumn Moon festival and saw everyone with boba, so we decided it was time to find our own. 

We found this purely on closeness to proximity, and were pleasantly surprised on how good it was.

We got the regular size Matcha Milk Tea with Tapioca Pearls (~$5.80 w/ tax). It was really tasty. Overall I'm not the biggest boba fan, but I liked what they got goin' on here. The staff is very friendly + helpful and they have nice couches for sittin'.

Yum.
author: Jamie J.

description:
Their tea tasted horrible and powdery. 

Ordered two teas. 

Taro milk tea 
Matcha milk tea 

Bother the teas we're not tasty at all. 

Found the tea place on yelp and they were the only ones open late close to where we had dinner do thought will try it out. Won't be coming back sadly.
author: Shanzay H.

description:
After some walking, on a time restraint, so plentea was outta my option so I walked by here first so this is it. 
.
Then when I went inside I was like so small. Not much seating more like 2 couches, and a table. 
.
Ordered my usual kumquat green tea with aloe, less ice and less sweet. The difference from sac is the price is 50 cents more in SF. 
.
The drink is still the same as sac. Of course its refreshing and thirst quenching. Love the large size. 
.
Overall if your craving a large drink that will last then this is the place for it. Number one roasted milk tea is my To go to unless I want refreshing drink then it be kumquat green tea. One thing that threw me off is the wet slippery floor where they make drinks. Just makes the place look unsanitary and feel kinda eeekkk.... makes me think of the water they use to make the tea and etc. So yea this place is prolly my pick up and on the go type of place for me. Walk and sip dont waste no time. Thanks for reading and have a yelptastic day!
author: Alex T.

description: Nice little boba shop in chinatown. Not a lot of space for seating but there's enough for your wait. Had to wait a bit for our drinks as I didn't see anyone else in the shop except for another girl but it wasn't too long. Drinks are between $3.50 and $4.50 and fairly worth it. I'd come back to try something else! :)
author: Gabby O.

description:
Never heard of this place until a friend had mentioned how good their grass Jellys were. While a group of us were scattered around Chinatown to line up for food and treats, we had a friend get us drinks here. 

Was told their roasted milk tea was recommended,  too bad they were all out that day so just got the regular milk tea with grass jelly . That jelly was so good . If you tried the Asian can grass jelly, you will know what I mean by fresh after trying theirs. It tastes bounced and the texture is just way better than the can version. 

Sugar can be adjusted but the line cannot. Luckily that day we didn't have to wait long but do be prepared. 

Recommend coming here to give their grass jelly a try and roasted milk tea along with the grass jelly. Will no regret.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Pros: the large is LARGE! I got that size before starting a four hour drive thinking I'd need something to drink while badly singing along to the radio. Drinks came out quickly. Interesting selection of games. 

Cons: everything else. The girl taking my order looked like she'd rather be anywhere else, milk tea didn't taste that great, boba was extremely mushy. And a large size of a mediocre drink isn't satisfying. 

Sure it may be a cool tea bar, but it was mostly empty when my friends and I came and I could definitely see why.
author: Emily L.

description: Pretty standard bubble tea. Not as much flavours as I would have liked, but the texture of the boba was perfect and u had an option to change the sweetness and the amount of ice you wanted
author: Stephanie A.

description: I got the kumquat green tea and it was pretty solid. Fresh tasting and pretty good flavor. There was only one person working and it's not a big shop. The inside has a few tables and seats but we got our drinks to go. Overall would come again if I'm in the area and wanted a quick drink.
author: Lawrence H.

description:
Been coming to Cool Tea Bar since they were at the Pacific location.  Back then, there were not too many good boba places in Chinatown and this one hit the spot whenever you needed a drink to quench your thirst.  I have always been a fan of their grass jelly roasted milk tea.  However, some high quality boba tea spots have since made a home in Chinatown as well, sinking Cool Tea Bar to just so so now in terms on price and quality.

I still stop here from time to time but I do have other favorites that I enjoy going to now when I am in the area.  However, I'm happy to hear that business is still running great for them and they have now expanded into the peninsula as well.
author: Janetto L.

description:
This place is a-ok... I get my usual jasmine milk tea with no boba; nothing special; heavy in milk/creamer.

I've never had this happen to me but had a round of drinks ordered via delivery. 

Now time for consumption -- I proceeded to stab my straw through the lid and had the milk tea make a mess in my general area. Splash damage! (Except not that fun, had to do clean-up duty)

The cup of milk tea I received had a slit in the middle of the cup; as if it was sliced and got cut. My cup was bleeding milk tea; likely a manufacturer defect or one of the employees messing around with the supplies. 

Very curious to know if this has happened to anyone else that has ordered drinks here ~__~
author: Sam K.

description: Wish they did frequent stamp card here, but they don't. I always get the same thing oolong lychee milk tea half sweet less ice. No one else around has that flavor. Usually no wait or a short wait which is also nice.
author: Stine H.

description:
Located in SF Chinatown, it's your typical boba tea shop. My daughter and nieces wanted one, so while visiting Chinatown, we stopped by. The small is still huge. They have black and clear boba teas, as well as other teas. 
Boba isn't really my thing, but if you're into it, I think Cool Tea Bar is probably something you'd enjoy.
author: Danielle G.

description:
This place is great! I come here often because I am always in the area. 

I ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea with Boba ($3.50 + $0.50) with a regular sweetness level. The tea tastes just about right and the boba is semisweet. For the most part, I can taste the tea which is a good thing! 

There never appears to be a line at this place, so I am able to get my drink pretty quickly.

I will be coming back!
author: Kristina M.

description: Cheap drinks, big portion, and fast service.  Love their mango 101!  Def great alternative if you're on a go.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Prettt decent boba place. It wasn't too busy when I went so the cashier offered to give us free samples of any of their top 10 drinks. The samples were made to order which was nice of them. I tried the following: 

Roasted milk tea with grass jelly - their most popular drink. A bit too sweet for me but you can adjust the sweetness levels to your liking

Kumquat green tea - I would order this again. Refreshing and light. Not too sweet perfect on a warm/hot day. 

Definitely would come here again if Im in the area. They have a pretty extensive menu to choose from and the cashiers were really accommodating. 

Notes:
Accept credit card. Small place with a few tables inside for seating.
author: Kristy L.

description:
Out of the old, into the new! As the previous "Cool Tea Bar" (not too far from here) closed not too long ago, they officially relocated or permanently placed at a different location at the same neighborhood at Chinatown's Waverly Pl in San Francisco. What does Cool Tea Bar do? They offer the customers of all ages to slurp their finest creations of bubble teas, refreshing juices and standard iced teas combined! The atmosphere and the concept remain the same as most Cool Tea Bar locations has across California, yet it's much smaller compared to Sky Parkway location in Sacramento. It's much cleaner and tidy inside with few chairs and tables around.

The baristas here are doing a good job for making the customers like me a remarkable service. No cons at all.

Now onto the drinks! I ordered two drinks of: Honey Green Tea with black bobas (no sugar) and Honey Lemon Aloe (30% sugar preference); both in regular sized to-go cups. As my father and I drank both drinks, they were perfectly good! The Honey Green Tea tasted perfectly because I can feel the natural flavors of green tea and honey combined without adding additional sugar! On the other hand, the Honey Lemon Aloe also tasted not bad as my father did feel the aloe crunch and the minor sweetness of the honey and lemon. Not bad for some good refreshments after hanging around at Chinatown for nearly 3 hours long!

Parking at Cool Tea Bar can be challenging to park. You can park at the nearby surface metered street parking nor the parking garage if it's available. You can also ride a bike, walk, carpool, ride sharing or public transportation easier without the hassles and gimmicks.

In the end, this Cool Tea Bar at Waverly Pl is closely, definitely the finest bubble tea shop that I've ever visited right here at San Francisco's Chinatown. Perfect for friends and family gatherings. My rating: 4 solid stars.
author: William L.

description:
# 5 Cool Tea  *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
Cool Tea was also a surprise as a I had low expectations from this chain. What stood out for me was the "freshness" of the tapioca balls. I would definitely return and it checks in at # 5 (of 38 ) in my Boba SF rankings below.

Rod M tours San Francisco in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  Check out my latest reviews for the most up to date list. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #30  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible
* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale. 

# 1 Itea *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 9/9 *Rod's Yelp Rating *5 stars 
# 2 Puppy bobar *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 8/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *5 stars 
# 3 Caffe Central *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 7/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 4 Cool Tea  *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 7/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars

# 9 Keep it *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 6/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars

# 14 Eightea *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 6/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 15 Enter the Café *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 5/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 16 Asha Tea House *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 7/9 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars

# 20 Boba Guys *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars

# 22 T&T Café *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 23 Bobo Drinks & Pho *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 24 Samovar Tea *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 25 5 sweets *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 26 Kestourine Macarons *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating * stars 
# 27 E Tea *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 4/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 28 Steap (not Steep) *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 4/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 29 Maggies Café *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 30 Belly Good Café & Crepes *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 31 Tea Bear *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 32 Sweet Heart Café *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 33 Honeycreme *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 34 Elixiria *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 35 Quickly *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 36 Plentea *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 37 Mi tea *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 38 Ten Ren Tea *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 39 Wonderful Foods/Dessert & Café *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 40 Out the Door *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 41 I Café *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 42 Phusion *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 3/2 *Rod's Yelp Rating *1 stars
author: Rod M.

description:
My friend recommended this place for the roasted milk tea with grass jelly (#1) and it was really good. I'd suggest 70% sweetness which was perfect. It has a nice roast milk flavor with really silly grass jelly, almost like silken tofu. 

Fast service and reasonable prices. It's really small inside so take it and go.
author: Brian G.

description: A friend introduced me to this place a while back saying it's a pretty good spot to grab boba. I appreciate how it's closer to the center of Chinatown so it's a pretty good walk from any point in the area. The shop itself is pretty small, but there is enough space to chill a bit. My friend bought me a Jasmine Milk Tea since he thinks it's the "best drink from here, " and I honestly wasn't disappointed by that claim. We went here pretty late, so I like the fact that the hours of business here are long. Definitely recommend checking this place out if you're in Chinatown!
author: Danielle M.

description: The workers are super chill. The place gets super busy but you'll miss the tourist boba craze lines. It's tucked right by china town. It is def a super tony store but orders come out super quick even if there is a small line. It's a run of the mill boba shop so don't expect any crazy or coool drinks to appear. If you're ever craving boba and don't want to wait in a super long line then i def recommend this spot.
author: Na X.

description:
rating: 3.5
we ordered the passionfruit 101 which had a pretty good flavor and was very sweet and lychee jelly and boba (sort of hard) weren't bad. Liked the seating arrangement and the sizes were huge.
Don't know if i'll go out of my way to come back but it undoubtedly palatable.

rankings
flavor/freshness/boba texture/total (out of 5) and ranking next to the 8 chinatown boba shops

person a: 5/5/4/13
person b: 4.5/4/5/13.5
person c: 5/5/4/14
person d: 5/5/4/14
person e: 3/4/3/11
me: 4/3/3/11
average: 4.4/4.1/3.3/11.8 #3
author: Boba R.

description: Not bad price for super large size order! I like to add grassjelly/redbean and sometimes pudding to my honey green tea or fruit teas / 20% sweet. Haven't been here physically since it's all delivery by grubhub. Give them a try, it's refreshing to drink at night =)
author: Vee V.

description:
Consistently good boba, and the cups are huge!

Being located in Chinatown, this place can get busy with a line of tourists, but visit in the evenings, and service is quick!

My go-to place when I've got that 11pm boba craving. (Yeah, they're open until 12am!)
author: Constance J.

description: Well this boba place is not bad but I ordered and after that, they just told me that they were out of boba.  If they had told me earlier, I might have not ordered at all.  I mean boba without the boba is missing something.  The tea, jasmine milk tea, however, was pretty good but without the boba it felt missing.  I also asked for less ice but i felt it was more than less.  3.5 rating
author: Jocelyn B.

description:
34 mins to pick up a drink. 

The service is not nice. They have no sense of urgency in spite of 12 boba cups lined up on the counter. Stop taking orders and start making drinks. 

The big open space is filled with people waiting for their drinks. people are sitting and playing with store provided games but I came here for a drink. 

Incredibly annoyed at the longest wait time I've ever waited for a tea drink. The oolong is too sweet despite asking for half sweet. There is no hint of the lychee flavor which is what I ordered: oolong lichi milk tea. 

There was a nice couple that opened the glass door for us. They were smart. I don't think they ordered anything and left. I should have done the same when I saw their lack luster menu. 

If you don't have the staff to keep up with demand of business to make good tasty quality drinks, close down already. Refund of my time and money and calories please.
author: Vicky L.

description: Excellent tea bar. I ordered the passion fruit green tea with the full sugar amount. I wouldn't recommend asking for the full sugar amount as it was a little much. However, I ver much enjoy the ability to alter the sugar level. The added customer variety enhances the experience. There is a connect 4 set as well as other games in the waiting area to occupy guests. Shop is not big enough for a big group get together, but rather a grab and go kind of feel. Would return again for another visit.
author: Trevor J.

description: If you're into fruity drinks, I definitely would recommend getting the Passion Fruit 101. This was my first time here, so I asked the person working what the 101 meant. It means that you get boba and lychee jelly in your drink. That was perfect for me. The drink was pretty good. I mean nothing amazing, but it was still a quality boba drink. The drinks are also not that expensive here compared to other boba places. I would definitely come back.
author: Allyson L.

description:
The matcha green tea smoothie was good! Although it could be better. I took a sip of the matcha smoothie and there was still a little bit of powder there. 3 stars because the customer service was good along with the sweet boba.

Update: I got the oolong milk tea and Red bean milk tea 2/11/17. The customer service was awesome, working hard and smiling. The oolong milk tea was delicious and the red bean was good also. Definitely try the oolong milk tea! +1 star
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
Cool Tea Bar has almost thirty different options for one to choose from as well as seven common toppings, including but not limited to aloe vera, tapioca pearls, and grass jelly. They ask for your favorite sweetness level, and you can request a dairy substitution or for less/more ice. There is rarely a line because the barista(s) works fast and efficiently; the staff is sweet and helpful.

My go-to order is the matcha tea latte because the matcha flavor is strong in the drink and the aloe vera/boba combination suits it perfectly. Including the toppings (each one is $0.50), my total for a large, which is roughly the size of a Big Gulp, is approximately $6, which is not too bad for a customizable drink that tastes good. Overall, it is definitely worth a try!
author: Annie C.

description: Pearl milk tea and oolong litchie pearl tea are awesome! Service was great, waited a couple of minutes to get our order :)
author: Kristina O.

description: Just stumbled upon this place and its so cute! Barista was really sweet and polite. Will be back soon! They have games too :)
author: Amber M.

description:
2.5 STARS

Wanted a tea, so I decided to stop by Cool Tea Bar on Wednesday, May 11th around 1:30pm.

I was actually craving a black tea with boba and grass jelly, but I guess Cool Tea only does milk teas? I had no idea, but I walked all the way from downtown for a tea, so I just ordered a Pearl milk tea with grass jelly, no sugar ($4.91 total with tax). It was way too milky for me, but the sweetness was right. I'm kinda bummed to find out they have all their teas premixed. At least that's what I'm thinking as that can be the only reason why they can't just do a plain black tea.

Okay place to grab a milk tea, but if you want black tea without milk, go elsewhere as they don't have that here.
author: Elena N.

description:
Really good milk tea! This place has been consistent since they opened up their old location on Pacific. I typically order the roasted milk tea or the jasmine milk green tea--both are delicious. 

They ask for your preferred sweetness level, which is nice because I personally feel like their drinks are a bit too sweet. I always go for 70% sweetness, but it still tastes like 100% sweetness, so keep that in mind!
I took off a star because their regular size is around $4, which is pricey for milk tea.
author: Maggie L.

description:
Was drawn here after trying their free tea on the street, because it's good.

However, there was a Chinese beggar wearing gold and jade jewelries non-stopped bugging everyone for money, NOT FOOD.  If you're an Asian, she would be very persistent till you finally gave in.  When an Asian girl offered her food, she refused and asked for money only.  To our surprise, the tea store didn't do anything to chase her away.  She was even sitting right next to us in the store while we're waiting for our tea.  When we left, she remembered I hadn't contributed any $ to her and made her final move again.  I watched Asian news, so I know these kinds of scams or fake beggars, so she ain't getting nothing from me.
author: Eric T.

description: I really liked the matcha w/ leechee jelly! It was a great value for the large too. We came when it was quiet, but could be slow with a line since they take time to make the drinks custom & right ^_^
author: Mary H.

description:
It was a hot day of eating dumplings while walking in the hot May sun.  We got thirsty and low and behold Yelp mentioned this place nearby.  Good find.
  The location is small, but their drink sizes make up for that.  The Milk Tea boba was pretty good.  They let you choose the amount of sugar you want added.
  The service is quick and cordial.  I've tried several boba places in San Francisco, and for the price, size, and convenience, this place is good.  
  They have places to plug your phone and it's convenient location to other good food places is a plus. But then again there's plenty of good spots around there.  
  It comes down to it's good boba at a good price in a place with tons of competition and others places with lengthy waits.  It can compete with them.  Either way, check it out. It's good.
author: Carlos T.

description:
I'm not sure why they closed down their other stores but at least the tea hasn't changed. They make a lot of the tea at the beginning of the day and have them in coolers that they kind of just keep on the counter to dispense from. 

I love the fact that you have so many options for "toppings" like boba pearls and grass jelly. The boba is not as chewy as I'd prefer, but they're not overly sweet either. You can also choose the level of sweetness and I think 50% is just perfect. At this point, you're not overwhelmed by sugar and instead the tea flavors just seem to come out stronger. 

I've had the taro, roasted oolong, and red bean. The first two were great but the red bean was just milk tea with some whole red bean inside with the boba. I wish they had blended them in or something because I ended up drinking all the tea and had weird clumps of red bean and boba left over.

Overall, great spot! Just need to try out more of their flavors.
author: Liza X.

description:
TL:DR - Drinks aren't blended too well. 

The drinks in this place are okay. They're okay because I've ordered #6 a few times and every time they blend it, it's always chunky and the ice chunks are pretty big and it doesn't seem like it's blended well enough. Fast service and the price was decent. They also have free wifi. Password is on the wall.
author: Herman X.

description: Cool Tea Bar is one of my favorite Boba places in the city. Nothing fancy like Boba guys or Plentea, but the flavor is super clean and good, and it is relatively cheap compared to other Boba places. I would recommend getting 75% sweetness in anything you are ordering, and I always get the Grass Jelly instead of Boba.
author: Yeji S.

description:
Two stars for service as the folks there are nice and the price is good if you want a huge amount of tea and you're used to Quickly or Tpumps.

This tea...isn't great. It got the lowest sugar amount for the oolong and it was still sickeningly sweet and I couldn't taste the tea. This is the only time I've ever tossed a milk tea because it was undrinkable. My brother got the matcha, and that, too, was also undrinkable. The matcha isn't great quality and tasted very, very off. I got my parents the taro milk tea, and that, too, was met with "thanks for thinking of us but please never get that for us again ever".

It sounds like other folks have had better drinks, so perhaps the non-milk teas are better.

Even though this place is close to my parent's home, I'd rather drive to the city to Mr. T or to Millbrae for Search Tea.
author: Robbin A.

description:
Small place in the middle of Chinatown. They have another location close by in the Financial District. Not sure why the two locations are so close to each other, but they're the only two in SF.

I ordered the Mango Green Tea with boba pearls, which came out to $4 + tax (~$4.26). First off the boba pearls were great--very soft and sweet :) However, the drink tasted very fruity--I could not taste the tea as much. It wasn't that it was too sweet (the sweetness was fine), it was that I wouldn't be able to tell it was a mixed tea drink if I went in blind. 

I have to give them 3.5 stars for now, but willing to come back and try the other flavors!
author: Vasiliy M.

description:
I was craving for boba one day during lunch at work and so was my friend who worked nearby me. Apparently, the other two Cool Tea Bar locations that were closer to us closed down recently and I'm not sure why. We wanted something good, so we made the effort to walk a little further to come to this location's Cool Tea Bar. It is located in an alley parallel to Grant street and Stockton street so it is convenient at the Heart of Chinatown.

I ordered their #1 special which was the Roasted Oolong Milk Tea with Grass Jelly. The tea tastes fresh and smooth and the grass jelly tastes sweet and herby. My sweetness level was less than half sweet which was perfect since I don't like my tea overly sweet.
author: Allie Y.

description:
09.27.16

Indian Summer continues in San Francisco. Cooling off with the Jasmine Green Milk Tea was the right choice. https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cool-tea-bar-san-francisco-4?select=yGw3SzWw6riKGnWyn8WlJQ

Total damage: $3.82
author: Jenny L.

description:
I was a little hesistant trying this location due to the lack of reviews. However, after trying their warm red bean milk tea, I'm hooked! It's not too sweet or hot...just right on a rainy day in SF. Plus, they have complimentary wifi and great customer service (unusual in chinatown). I recommend it if you're just looking for a place to relax or catching up with old friends! 

Open from 11 to midnight! :)
author: Gaby J.

description: All the drinks take a long time to make so you better have some patience. The good thing is that you can customize the sweetness of each drink. The place is tiny and gets stuffy quick so place your order and wait outside.
author: Shelton F.

description: Not my favorite. I got a honey green tea boba and all the flavors seemed watered down but was still pretty good. The boba was very chewy and broke apart almost instantly. The service was good, the atmosphere was nice and they provide games to create a chill hangout spot. Pretty average menu.
author: Miles M.

description:
Went after seeing all the reviews and having the usual boba craving
I got the plain milk tea with boba with 75% sugar but i kind of wish i got it less sweet since i still found that amount to be quite sweet
I love that you can customize the sweetness though and the milk tea itself was pretty good ~
author: Julia K.

description:
Definitely my favorite go-to boba stop in SF! 

Highly recommend the:
-#1 Grass Jelly Roast Milk Tea (I like mine half sweetened)
-Matcha Smoothie (Good with boba, red bean, or grass jelly)
-Mango Green Tea (Nice and refreshing with aloe or lychee jelly)

Pricing is a tad on the higher side but it is definitely worth it in comparison to other boba joints, especially with all the new ones opening in the area. I would say CTB definitely has a distinct taste of its own and sticks to the traditional roots, not to mention it's a favorite of locals in the area.
author: Katie G.

description:
Just had a simple black milk tea with boba which was pretty good.  Feel of the place was a somewhat typical boba place.  They played pretty modern music but did have canto music too funny enough.  The location was a good one, near the many shops and restaurants in Chinatown.  While we thought the drink was a little sweet, they do have an option to lower the sweetness, I'm assuming sugar, level.  

Would definitely come back to this spot.
author: Alexander C.

description: Disappointing let down for milk tea. Probably won't come back. Menu is small and they don't have very many selections. On top of that they were out of classic milk tea.
author: Gino C.

description: Nice small place, nice cashiers, clean. Bubbles taste sweet and chewy. However, the regular milk tea was average (3/5). I typically order 1/2 sugar no ice so maybe here it requires a little more sugar. Also the large tea is bigger than a lot of other bubble tea spots.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Dangerous for me that this place opened.
I work less than a block away and their drinks are addictively good.  Trying their original store in the Miriwa Building on Pacific, I knew their menu.
If you enjoy fruity flavors, the main options are the mango or passion fruit teas (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q&select=WLlsaoXJ1q9DtHPhJAfDHg).
Like that they give you a choice of degrees of sweetness as my orders are usually 50%.
Certain drinks have free add-ons so do read the menu carefully.  
The staff is hit or miss given that it is a new store.  Not sure whether the guy there is a partner/owner, but he knew his stuff as some of the gals seem lost.
This will come in handy when summer rolls around as we're sweating it out in the office.
author: Mike C.

description: Not sure if the tea they have is different, but it taste so strange compared to other Boba places? The cool balls are definitely cool and delicious but the drinks are subpar and expensive. I wouldn't recommend this place at all.
author: Rice E.

description: Ordered a jasmine milk tea w/30% sugar, which was watery to the point where I could barely make out what flavor it was. I've had plenty of milk teas with zero sugar where they were still very flavorful. Maybe it was a fluke? I did like the lychee jelly as a boba substite though.
author: Jenny B.

description:
Recommendation: Good bubble tea, not as wide a selection as other places though. Easy, clear instructions. I'd explore other places just because they exist, but I had only a few issues with Cool Tea.
Tip: It's not ON Clay Street, so look down the little alleyways. It's about 2-3 shops in and has a giant "Cool" on the sign.
Tip: Accepts credit cards, unlike most bubble tea places. Thank goodness!

We were in the mood for some bubble tea, and the Cool Tea Bar was close by and open on Sunday, so we decided to give it a try! It was a little confusing to find because the map pointer on mobile devices doesn't show the side street, so we almost walked past it before we realized it was on the alley street and not the main street. Regardless, there was another bubble tea place right across the street if we hadn't been able to find it. 

Once inside the shop, you are greeted with a dimly lit but brightly painted establishment! There was only one staff member working when we were there, but it can get crowded at times which can drive the wait time up. There also are a few tables to sit at, which most bubble tea places don't offer for patrons looking to sit down and wait or just hang out. Even better, there's free WiFi! There's a sign a little above head level on the left when you walk in, if you want to see the password. On the opposite wall is a TV with some of the menu items, and attached to the cash register is a little billboard with additional items. I was surprised at how few options there were! I'd say Cool Tea probably only has a third of the options of a place like Tea Era. The only fruity options were passionfruit green tea and mango green tea, for example. 

I ordered a mango green tea with boba, and unfortunately the boba ratio was quite far off. I finished all the boba with about a third of the drink left, which left me sadly drinking the rest with nothing to chew. However, the drink was really good! A great mix of mango flavor without overpowering the green tea, and the sugar level was spot on. 

All in all, I think Cool Tea was okay. I think it's a safe place to go back to if I didn't want to explore, but it would definitely take a lot to keep me from trying one of the other myriad bubble tea shops in Chinatown and the surrounding area. I don't think I'll be going back any time soon, but it's good to know that it exists!
author: John B.

description: I used to like this place a lot until I emailed their catering email and they never got back to me. I planned on having them cater my son's 1st birthday, but seeing as though it takes over a month to respond, my son will turn 2 by the time they arrive with our drinks.
author: karina p.

description: Pretty great boba place. I came for milk tea and it was fairly great. I have no qualms. I wouldn't say it's the best, but I'm fairly happy with it. There was no wait and the service friendly. It's just in a weird location so you wouldn't find it unless you were walking down a random alley or actually looking for it.
author: Jenn T.

description: My friends and I suddenly had late night cravings of boba (mind you this was about 11:30 pm). The only boba place that was open was 'Cool Tea Bar'. The place didn't seem quite bad from the internet pictures and really it WAS NOT that bad in person. The staff was friendly but as soon as I tasted that boba I was like ??? The serving of boba was so big but honestly there was like at least 10 tapioca balls in my drink. On the other note the tapioca was such a weird texture. It was quite disappointing but the drink itself was tolerable. Also, the place is SO SMALL. There were about six teenagers hanging out in there and I honestly felt suffocated, maybe because they were all cramped into the front when there was a bit space left on the side.
author: Tanya D.

description:
Literally such horrible service.

Came here at about 10pm .

1star for the service. 3 people in here one on the ipad another eating chipotle talking to the guy on the ipad
author: Jordan V.

description: I am very picky when it comes to tea and boba, and I was pleasantly surprised to find this place in Chinatown. Bf and I were honestly not expecting much, as there were no big name tea places nor were there any places with tons of reviews, but it was close by so we gave it a shot. The girls there had a bit of a language barrier, but once I spoke their language (cantonese), it was much easier to explain how we wanted our drinks and to get our order right. Their large cups are a whopping 32oz! Not to mention the tea was very tasty and had fresh fruit--I got lemon, and I think bf got grapefruit or something. Both teas were very refreshing and lasted us forever (okay just me forever, bf drinks his liquids fast). I would definitely come here again if we are in the area...what a nice hidden spot!
author: Monica L.

description:
Cool Tea Bar is a nice little cafe for bubble tea that is actually within Chinatown. There are so many in the area, but they all tend to be on the outskirts of Chinatown either on Kearny or on Powell. This makes Cool Tea Bar a convenient choice when walking around within Chinatown!

The workers here are really nice and do a good job with implementing their sweetness levels. I usually find 50% sweetness at other boba places still too sweet, but this place got it just right! I tried the matcha milk tea here and it was as solid as it would be at other places nearby. There's also some nice seating here and wifi as well which is a plus.
author: Joshua M.

description:
5 star rating because there is one drink they do perfectly: black milk tea, 100% sweetness. This is the best "standard" milk tea (no fancy flavors) I have ever had; strong tea taste and a sweet condensed milk background flavor.

Everything else on the menu is pretty average. I tried the black milk tea at 80% sweetness, but the rich condensed milk flavor was gone. If you want anything besides the original, you're better of at a different store.
author: Brittany L.

description: Pearl Milk Tea in Standard sweet.... so yummy. My picky kids liked it as much as the fancier bubble teas they get at the trendy spots.
author: Crissy F.

description: their taro milk tea taste like shit. it's not even taro milk tea, it's more like over due milk tea. made me feel sick after drinking it. they don't have that much choice for drinks as well. would never go back. y'all suck.
author: Stacy C.

description:
Tea Quality: (3/5) The tea quality is standard, pleasant but nothing special. The regular sweetness level was a bit too much. The amount of tea in the regular size is more than enough.

Boba: (4/5) The boba is quite good. Not too sweet, and good amount of firmness even for those with delicate teeth. However, some pearls were too soft and resulted in an unpleasant chew.

Atmosphere: (3/5) A few seats for those that wish to sit in this cramped space. However, it is located in the heart of Chinatown and contributes well to all of its glory. Music selection is normal, nothing too crazy. Service was inviting, apologized for a small delay.

Price: (4/5) $4.50 is a decent price for a regular sized pearl milk tea.

Conclusion: (4/5) We had a hour long debate over whether to give this place a 3 or 4. We decided to go with a 4/5 because the only thing sweeter than the tapioca was the service. 

__________________________

Brought to you by the Boba Connoisseur, your unbiased guide to boba worldwide.
author: Boba C.

description: Large sizes are really large. Really good quality boba. Customize the usual. A little seating if you're lucky.
author: Peter C.

description:
Get the #1! Roasted oolong with grass jelly, with 50% sweetness. That was amazeballssss! Perfect sweetness, you can certainly taste the tea, and they give a lot of good/fresh grass jelly.

The mango green tea with 30% sweetness was also very refreshing on a hot day. The pricing is totally worth it.. if you get a large for $4.50.. it is so, so big, beware!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Highly recommended their Mango Green Tea and Oolong Milk Tea. The drinks are a bit too sweet, so I would recommend getting a lower percentage for the amount of sugar in your drinks. The large cup of drinks DOES WORTH the high price.
author: Jenny L.

description: This place was awesome, service was great..they even let us try out some of the jellies, will go back next time I'm in town. Only downside is that there are not enough flavors of tea or bubbles, it's definitely a more authentic bubble tea place.
author: amal s.

description:
Awesome place to get your Boba fix while walking around Chinatown!! I was pleasantly surprised with how good they were!

I ordered a large Almond Milk Tea with Boba. Price was about $3 and some change. My boyfriend ordered a drink as well (I can't quite remember what he got though). They do offer a wide selection to choose from regarding tea flavors. You can also pick how much sweetness you want as well (I got 30% which was perfect for me). We were the only ones there when we ordered, so our drinks came out in a few minutes. Not sure how fast or slow they are when they are more busy. Employees here were helpful and nice, but spoke little English, which is fine. 

Both my boyfriend and I loved our tea and finished them off!! Cool Tea Bar has a cute bar area you can sit at while drinking  your tea that overlooks the street. Very warm and inviting! I enjoyed the setting here too. 

I would come back here!

Cheers!
author: Michelle M.

description: the classic milk tea is amazing! i tried the hot version with 0% sugar and it's perfect, sweet enough from the milk. highly recommend!
author: Naomi S.

description: Meh. The jasmine green tea wasn't as fragrant as I remembered and boba was hard and tasted stale. I used to really love getting CTB boba at the shop in the mall on Pacific... But they shut down!!! Whyyyy
author: Alice C.

description:
Yay! Another great boba place in Chinatown! The place itself doesn't look like much, but hey, at least the tea tastes great! This place serves a variety of milk teas with different toppings. I ordered a regular sized milk pearl tea. So delicious! The tapioca pearls were very soft and yummy. 

The only thing that isn't great about this place is the long wait. When my co-workers and I stopped by, there was only 1 staff working (very inefficient in my opinion). We ended up waiting at least 10 minutes for our drinks; however, despite the long wait, I would definitely be coming back in the future when I have another boba craving.
author: Gwendolyn M.

description: super slow service and long wait times to get watered down milk water. i passed by this place and grabbed a regular milk tea for my wife and mom. i dropped the drinks off to them at their work. my mom took a sip and immediately chucked the drink straight into the trash. i asked her whats wrong with the drink she said it doesnt even taste like milk tea more like watered down milk. my wife took a sip and she said it tasted awful. i did believe it so i gave it a try myself. after that try i would have to say its hands down the worst milk tea i have ever tried in my life.  it didnt even have a hint of tea flavor. Anyways save your money and go elsewhere for your boba drinks. there are plenty of better quality shops nearby.
author: Art N.

description: Good portions, reasonable price, good quality boba, quick service and a great location in the middle of Chinatown - what more can you ask for!  I'm glad my friend told me about this place.  She told me have you been to a cool tea bar, and said yes, I've been to a cool tea bar before - but I didn't know she was talking about The Cool Tea Bar!  Well, now I know better and will know to stop by next time I'm in the area.
author: Maile N.

description: Got the classic milk tea with pearls 1 regular sweetness. Great drink and the pearls weren't too hard, like at some other places. We definitely come again
author: Brandon B.

description:
Oh myyyyy.

Pro: a rare bubble tea place open until midnight.

Con: the taro - WTF?!

Taro is my default; I order it 9 times out of 10 that I get bubble tea. Even when using powder, which is probably most of that time, it never turns out the awful consistency that it did at this place. It was grainy... Almost like there were curds in the drink?! Honestly, not drinkable. I rarely complain, but had to insist that I get a complimentary replacement. They were able to meet that request, and generally had an okay attitude about it, but were completely ignorant about the taro consistency, as though it were my problem that I wasn't used to the messed-up texture. What?! Blegh.
author: Shendi X.

description: We went to cool tea bar because purple kow had a line out the door. I was not impressed with cool tea's service or tea. It was very ordinary and quite expensive. Also they do not have much variety as far as different types of teas but the lychee jelly was really good.
author: Garret W.

description: Meh.  Nice service decent options.  I went for a Kumquat green tea.  Was refreshing and not super sweet (went for the 50% option) but with the $4 price tag on a small I think there are some better options in the area.
author: Kelsey B.

description: I went here on Saturday at noon. It was fairly crowded; the line extended out the door and I waited for about five minutes before ordering. One thing I appreciated a lot was the sign with the the top 10 most popular drinks because it was my first time getting boba there. Taking advice from the sign, I got the kumquat green tea, which I had never tried from any other place. The place itself is quite small and it wasn't that comfortable to stand squished next to everyone else, although it wasn't terrible. It took about five more minutes for my drink to come out. The boba was good quality and the tea was average. Overall, I was happy with what I got.
author: Jocy G.

description:
Just randomly walked the streets of China Town and alas! A wild boba shop appears right when I was craving some see black balls (yes, I'm too much, I know). 

I took a look at their best sellers and went with the classic pearl milk tea. If they can't get the basics right, then it ain't worth my time. Trust me, you'll want to spend hours here. 

Definitely the best pearl milk tea I've had by trying a random boba joint. Sweet, chewy tapioca, just the right amount of sweetness, strong robust flavor that isn't water downed. Definitely keeping Cool Tea Bar in my top list of boba spots.
author: Tanaya C.

description:
Cool! This place is my first review on my return to yelp. What brings me back you might ask? I don't go to THAT many establishments so my New York reviews have been lacking. In response to this I have traveled the west coast for the first time ever and have quite the load. Now onto the review.

Of course I had to try bubble tea on the west coast and jeeze did this place not disappoint. I got the classic milk tea with bubbles and tried the roasted tea as well. Man is this stuff on a whole nother level from here. I'm a firm believer in mom and pop shops, and the moment I walked into here I noticed how local it feels. Spot on. Loved it, thanks for making my few days in San Francisco more memorable.
author: Arthur Z.

description: If you find yourself in Chinatown, getting boba is a must. I've been to other Cool Tea Bar locations before, and this one was smaller but still just as awesome as the others. Service was attentive and fast. The menu is straightforward. I ordered Red Bean Milk Tea with boba (with 75% sugar) and it always blows me away at how large the regular sized cup is. Any drink here will surely quench your thirst, especially on a warm SF day. Good solid bubble tea cafe. Would return again!
author: Stefanie C.

description: I think I may need to visit this place a few more times and try some other flavors before I can make a final verdict, but my first impression of this bubble tea shop is that it is a pretty standard option. I got a regular matcha milk tea with boba and half sugar, but it was still a bit too sweet for what I like from matcha milk tea. The boba was small, but chewy and not too soft. They have two sizes, a regular and large, which is really just large and larger. My drink was $4.91 after tax, which is a bit on the expensive side, and though there was quantity, there wasn't quite the quality I would've liked! On the bright side, there wasn't a line at 6 PM on a Sunday and the tea came out very quickly.
author: Stephanie H.

description: After having lunch from Spicy King across the street, I was excited to come here. I rarely come to Chinatown so I want to take advantage getting boba while here. I ordered their popular drink which was the roasted milk tea with grass jelly and no sweet. I loved how it really was not sweet but I can still taste the flavors. It was a bit milky to me but oh well. Husband got the mango iced tea and whoa that was strong.
author: Claire J.

description: Came as a group of 4 last night to have some boba milk tea as Plentea decided to close three hours early and iTea was also closed at the time. This place seems to be open late so that was convenient. Once we arrived, the server let us know that they were out of boba. Seriously? The one main ingredient and you are out? That is like a sushi shop being out of rice. He was kind enough to let us sample a couple of the other items like the cool balls and grass jelly. We were the only ones waiting to order at the time and it seems like the girl helping make drinks was either new or did not know what she was doing because it took entirely too long to make 4 drinks. The milk tea itself was pretty tasty and the sizes are nice and big. However, given the option, I mightgo somewhere else if I am having a late night boba craving.
author: Andy A.

description:
Great place for the sweet drinks.

Everytime I visit here I order the Jasmine Milk Tea, Kumquat Lemon Tea, or Grass jelly Roasted Milk Tea. (Personally, a lot of these drinks are too sweet, avoid the standard level if you're trying to watch the sugar) 

It's a little pricier than other ordinary spots that serve boba drinks, but you won't mind it when you start obsessing over this place.
The sizes are big and they open late till Midnight.
author: Wayne C.

description:
Pro tip: the large is really big! I didn't realize that when I ordered 

The selection isn't huge but service was fast and attentive. Free wifi also which is a plus. The place was in Chinatown and I was able to sit down and figure out where to go next from here.
author: Laura Y.

description: LOVE This place!!!  I'm a fan of the roasted milk tea with grass jelly.  It's the best I've ever had.  I can never get anything else.  I am soooo addicted to it.
author: Lan T.

description: Grass jelly roasted milk tea with 30% sugar is very good. The only thing is the lack of grass jelly.
author: Jensen K.

description: $6.50 is wayyyy overpriced for this random boba place in China town. I ordered regular taro milk tea with boba and it was the strangest taro tea I've tried before. The girl at the counter was friendly and did warn me it would have a thicker consistency, but that wasn't the issue. The consistency wasn't any different then any other tea, but it did have some grainy (taro/rice chunks?& yes It was different then when you add regular taro as a topping) not sure what it was but it was odd/grossing me out. It's also unfortunate they did not make taro smoothies as I usually prefer that consistency. I guess it isn't made with artificial flavoring, but I wasn't really aware, glad I tried it but not for me. Anyways not sure how the other drinks are since taro is the only thing I order when I get boba.
author: Hoku L.

description: My favorite Oolong milk tea with grass jelly! Never too sweet because they allow for sweetness and ice adjustments I just wished this place was closer to home!
author: Alice K.

description: The place was packed w customers but there were only two people working. Prices were a little expensive, 4.00 for a drink w/o boba. They took over 25 minutes to give me one drink. Then told me they ran out. They offered to change my order and when I accepted and chose something else, they wanted to charge me extra. When I finally got my drink it was the wrong order. The drink I received (iced green tea) tasted okay though.
author: April P.

description:
I think I'm addicted to grapefruit because it seems that that's all I get when I get tea. Yet again, I got a grapefruit green tea. It was pretty good, especially on a hot day, but it wasn't anything impressive. You do get to choose your sugar level and ice level which is cool (pun, hahaha).

Overall, it was a good thirst quencher on a hot day.
author: Sophia Y.

description: Cool Tea Bar is too expensive with too poor service to warrant the 4 star rating that it has. It doesn't have enough people working so I ended up waiting half an hour for one drink, which they got wrong.
author: Jenna A.

description:
This place is decent very small inside well it is in chinatown. They only  have five drinks on the menu and the drinks are pretty exotic you  can say. I order the kumquat tea which i never seen at a bobba place. So i gave it a try and it was pretty good and refreshing. My husband got the milk tea and it has lots of different jelly in it and he like it. You can tell them how sweet you want it so i like that.
I would defintely come  back here because their drinks are refreshing.
author: Hoa T.

description: I got the roast milk tea. The tea itself was absolutely delicious, but the boba tasted old. I would still come back though!
author: Anna H.

description:
Went to Cool Tea Bar with my hubby while in town for a Chinese festival. Got the recommendation for this place from one of the festival workers when we asked for a "good boba place." Got the original milk tea with boba- it was delicious and did not disappoint. I'm not a fan of overly sweet drinks, and I found that the tea here was perfect (sweet, but not too sweet). The boba was cooked to a soft and chewy perfection. Unlike other boba places, they didn't pack the drink full of ice, which meant that the drink was consistent from beginning to end and not watered down at the last drop. 

Word of caution- their large drink is HUGE. When we ordered, our thought process went something like "$4.00 for a regular and only 50 cents more for the large? We might as well go with the large," without realizing that large meant 32 oz of milk tea with boba. Delicious as it was, by the time I got to the last 1/6 of my drink, I thought I was going to throw up.
author: Sharon C.

description: I discovered Cool Tea Bar while wandering through Chinatown.  Their Boba was awesome!
author: Ben F.

description: Noticed Cool Tea Bar expanded their operations to Waverly Place which was a odd place to have a boba shop. I decided to go with the usual Oolong Milk Tea, but was informed that they do not offer Oolong at this location even though it was listed on the menu. I suppose they only offer a limited menu here due to the location and the size of the store. I settled with the Jasmine Milk Tea on their top drinks list since I did not want to guess what they have available. The Jasmine Milk Tea was nothing special, it tasted like regular milk tea with a heavy taste of creamer or milk. But on the bright side they do take credit cards which is rare in Chinatown. I would stick to the original location on Pacific for Cool Tea Bar.
author: Peter C.

description:
I stopped by here a couple of days ago after work. My friend has been raving about this place so I thought I'd give it a try. This please was in an alley but still visible if you were walking up clay street. Anyways, I walk in and it wasn't too much of a line. I ordered a black milk tea with boba and a passion fruit with lychee jelly. I couldn't decide what I felt like so I just got both... at the very least I could save one for the next day.

First off, can I say that I am a boba drink fanatic? Though my reviews won't show it BUT I do visit a lot of boba places and literally get a drink every other day if not everyday! So this place is not that impressive.... the black milk tea was practically all milk. There's like a tease of a flavor of tea but it is not apparent at all. Actually, that hint of flavor repulses me.. I couldn't even finish the drink! The boba was small and I wasn't sure if they are the kind of establishment that sells 2 sizes but if they did, i wanted the BIGGER BALLS! (teehee). So definitely not impressed with this drink.

Not much better with my 2nd drink. Passion Tea I know if already a sweet drink but this was overly sweet and no tea mixed in at all!!! The lychee jelly is standard so no complaints there, For a Cool TEA bar... there's is definitely a lack of tea in all their drinks. I definitely won't be coming back to this place anytime soon.... sorry but not sorry!
author: Mark L.

description: When you have teenagers running your shop, service will just not be up to par. After buying multiple drinks, they couldn't offer their pregnant customer more than a tiny cup of complementary water, and instead made me pay $4.34 for a "full price" large cup of water. And then stood snickering while filling it up cause "why would she pay that much for water?". Really, teenage girls? It's for a pregnant lady, and I already bought two other boba drinks. Learn some decency and kindness. Will not return.
author: Nomadic N.

description: You could go to a super fancy, white-washed boba shop on Kearny street, or you could hit up one of the three (used to be just the one inside the shopping plaza) Cool Tea Bars. If you choose the latter option, you'll pay the exact same price, but you'll get better quality. Now, there will be an iTea opening up in the area soon, so that will be your go-to, but until that day comes, Cool Tea Bar does the trick. The drinks aren't overly sweet, and you'll get decent quality tea. They customize, and they have plenty of toppings. The roasted oolong with grass jelly is a classic, but I highly recommend their matcha smoothie with red beans as well. Anything with 50% sweetness will do just fine. It's an extra 50 cents for a larger size, so go nuts. They also have free wi-fi if you want to work for a little bit, but that's not really a Ctown thing.
author: Danny C.

description: Stumbled across this place while meandering through Chinatown. Their large cups are tremendous!
author: Gerald C.

description:
I liked the boba and the lychee! I would give it four stars. It was chewy and yummy! I had the passion fruit 101 and chose 30% sugar. Personally it was too sweet for me. I should have opted no sugar. Most of their drinks are tea but they had a three/four "juice" flavors like the passion fruit 101.  

The service was good but nothing special. Three orders were taken before I came in and so it took 7-8 minutes to get my drink but I think that is normal when only two people are working. The place is small. Only two tables for two and bar style table for three. They only serve drinks, no food. They do have free WiFi for the customers. 

In all, if you happened to be in China Town and would like some boba (in tea or juice), I recommend it.
author: Michelle C.

description: This place offers your standard assortment of milk teas. It's clean (85 health score) and the staff are reasonably nice. The tea is good not great... but my wife and I both got headaches after drinking it.
author: Ben B.

description:
Cool new place for Boba tea. I got oolong with extra pearls. 
Quickly is a walking distance away but they were all our of Boba, which is ridiculous. 
This place is quite nice. They are pretty fast and make great tea.
author: Juliana B.

description: One of my favorite boba places. Wish there were more in my area so I could come here more often. Definitely recommend the roasted milk tea and mango green tea. Sizes are huge. Worth the money.
author: Chris M.

description: Drink quality is pretty good for the most part. Taro milk tea is horrible! Don't think the chunks in it are real taro; it feels like chunks of flour= no good... However, other milk TEAs and honey teas are pretty consistent and better than your average milk TEAs and teas from other places. I also enjoy the tapioca balls from here because they are super chewy with a hint taste of honey(: one minus is that an order for two drinks can add up to $10!!
author: Wendy T.

description: I used to like this place.  They had a bunch of locations scattered around Chinatown and they seemed to care.  Now it seems like they have given up on caring.  They can't even be bothered to keep in stock large cups.  I am not sure what is going on with these people, but it does not seem like they are even trying to stay afloat.
author: Matthew F.

description: Stopped by here yesterday for some boba and got a jasmine milk tea with egg pudding and boba. Usually boba spots are quick and dont take that long ESPECIALLY with multiple staff in the back. On my trip here i ended up waiting around 30 minutes because 15 min in i checked my ticket wondering why my boba wasnt ready yet. Thats when i realized that they skipped my number! I quickly asked them what happened to number 28 and they handed me another boba which was not my order so i let them know they gave me the wrong number. After giving me a confused look i repeated what i got and they said " oh okay! sorry. ill make it right now" so i patiently waited some more and the worker handed me a new drink which was jasmine milk tea with lychee and boba which was incorrect again. I mentioned i had not gotten lychee and had ordered egg pudding instead and she asked me " can i just add egg pudding?" uhhh no thank you lady, if i wanted lychee i wouldve ordered it. I guess my review is based on the lack of attention and extremely slow service at this location. Had i known getting one drink was going to take 30 minutes i would have not gone here haha i will probably give this place another try.. hopefully next time they get my drink right.
author: Samee M.

description:
Just came from here and was pleasantly surprised.

The male "bobarista" greeted me right away and was very helpful since I didn't know what to get. He gave me a sample of a kumquat green tea but in the end, I opted for the popular grass jelly roasted milk tea. 

It's really good, just the right amount of sweetness (30%) with a distinct tea flavor. 

Service was quick and super friendly. He ended with "have a good day!" Thanks! :D
author: Annie N.

description: Horrible attitude, the owner was so rude and mean!!! Worst milk tea in Chinatown!!! Do not waste your money
author: Changming C.

description: This is my go to place when I'm craving some boba milk tea late at night. It's also rather cool to hit Chinatown when it's dark and quiet. The beverages are solid, well priced and they offer a large size that is insanely large.
author: Doug V.

description: I came here knowing the the quality of drinks of the Sacramento location was great.  This place did not disappoint at all.  Something that was also consistent was that we were not greeted warmly or with smiles.
author: Peter-Nam D.

description: I recently discovered this hidden gem in the alley because I seldom venture to Chinatown. But now I have one reason to.....the kumquat tea with boba. The tea is refreshing and the boba is perfect.
author: Jen A.

description: Delicious milk tea. I got jasmine milk tea at 50% sugar and it's perfect. Not too sweet, just sweet enough. I'm definitely coming back here!
author: Jessica C.

description: Terrible tea and service. First off, I'm a fan of boba tea places. I ordered the Oolong milk tea with Lychee jelly and all I taste was sugar (30%) sweet milk, where's the tea in it? Also, the cashier asked if she should keep my $.70 which I thought that was flat out rude for customer.
author: David C.

description: So disappointed with this location. Not sure why they closed their other location on Pacific, which was their most popular location. The drinks here are not up to par with the their old location. The drinks are either too sweet or too watered down. I'm not sure if it's the people making the drinks or what not. This location also don't have some drinks the other location used to have: brown rice milk tea/tea. I have tried their Kumquat green tea (70% sweet), Mango green tea (70% sweet), Cool Tea Bar milk tea (50% sweet) from here and all the past experiences have not been pleasant at all. I would suggest going to iTea or HiTea around the area instead if you'd like some consistent and high quality tea.
author: Shanna C.

description: OMG! I get that this may be the only tea bar open at 1130pm. But do not go here. I ordered a taro milk tea with boba. I get it that many places may make it via powder or with artificial ingredients. But damn, when I took sips, you can feel the powder and the little chunks of things within the drink. I'd rather have a dry throat and drink something I enjoy and pay $20 rather than this piece of crap. It was completely horrendous. Do not go here. SF native, and this is by far disappointing. It is a disgrace to the many great places in SF.
author: Tony G.

description: YUM! Milk tea nowadays is getting expensive, and with this craze, I feel like there can be a HUGE scam (sometimes your drink is more ice than milk tea, sometimes there is one boba floating in your drink, etc). But Cool Tea Bar is a pretty good deal. Free Pro-Tip for any milk tea lover: always always always ask for little ice! Today, I forgot to ask for little ice, BUT I didn't even need to because when I looked at my classic roasted milk tea with grass jelly, it was only 2% ice. I was actually on market street and decided to walk PAST plentea to go to this place! My drink was $4 + $0.50 with grass jelly, and for $0.50 more, you can make it a large (but the regular size was enough to fill me up entirely).
author: Sophie D.

description: Nina's gorgeous. Theyhave a wide selection of milkteas, and options for the sugar level. Will come back again.
author: Jackson L.

description:
Lovely little boba place. I stumbled upon it when I was walking in my people's land in Chinatown. As I was walking with my friend, I suddenly realized the dire need for some boba consumption. Out of desperation, I type "boba" on google maps and walk two yards into this store. The store was not busy at the time and there was a shy asian boy at the counter. He was very nice in taking my order and answered my "whats good here" question fairly well.

I ended up getting the most basic milk tea with no boba and 50 percent less sugar. It was FANTASTIC. I was pleasantly surprised on the taste and freshness of the milk tea. It was so good I wouldn't stop shutting up about it. I will definitely be coming here again! Forget Plentea, what about COOL TEAAAA???!!!
author: Eileen W.

description:
Love all their drinks! My favorites are the roasted milk tea with grass jelly and jasmine milk tea. I have to get boba from here at least once a week as it's such a nice walk from financial district where I work at as well. I love how you can choose the right amount of sweetness. It's consistent and just as flavorful every time. 

I'm looking forward to my next visit already! Highly recommend!
author: Penelope P.

description: The large boba size is HUGE.  They gave us a free sample which was nice :)
author: Danielle R.

description: Best roasted milk tea in SF. The flavor is consistent every single time and it never disappoints. Workers here are super efficient and friendly. If you ever need a boba fix, this place is the place to go!
author: Therese F.

description: Small little place in Chinatown, and service was excellent.  We couldn't decide what to order so they offered to make samples for us to try.  We tried the mango 101, but decided to order their normal milk tea with boba, and 50% sweet.  it's one of the best I've had in a while. I'm glad we came and tried this place.
author: Virginia N.

description: Nothing special about the milk tea here nor is it better than any other places. However, customer service is bad here, at least for the cashier who was raising her voice and rushing us with orders. She evenly asked to keep my change of $.74 cents when I gave her a five dollar bill.
author: Tommy K.

description: Came here on Friday 4/10/15. Grass jelly roasted milk tea is all I order from Cool Tea Bar. It tastes more milky compared to the Pacific location. It's not bad, I just prefer Pacific location's stronger tea flavor.
author: Anita T.
